official-title.#text: To amend part A of title IV of the Social Security Act to require a State to deny assistance under the program of block grants to States for temporary assistance for needy families to a parent, caretaker relative, or legal guardian of a child who is not attending enough school, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Parental Accountability for Reducing Child Poverty Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Denial of TANF assistance to parent, caretaker relative, or legal guardian of child not attending enough school

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 408(a) of the Social Security Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the child attended school for at least the number of days that constituted the minimum school attendance then required under applicable State law for children who were then within the State’s compulsory school attendance age range (regardless of whether the age of the child was within that age range); or

in the case of a child who attended a school that was treated as a home school under State law, the child met all applicable State requirements with respect to such a school.

header.#text: Failure of state to deny assistance to parent, caretaker relative, or legal guardian of child not attending enough school

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect on October 1, 2015, and shall apply to attendance in school years beginning on or after August 1, 2014.
